00046 #define KVI_MIRCCOLOR_MAX_FOREGROUND 15
00047 #define KVI_MIRCCOLOR_MAX_BACKGROUND 15

00049 
00050 
00051 // ASCII Stuff: the following defines are meant to be escape sequences
00052 //              that can go thru an IRC connection
00053 
00054 // The following table is a 30-minute analysis of the escape characters commonly used over the IRC protocol...
00055 // created when looking for a good placement for the CRYPT escape char in KVirc.
00056 // I guess that the best chars to be used were FS,GS,RS,US,DC1,DC2,DC3,DC4...they have the "less defined"
00057 // meaning as ASCII control chars.
00058 // mmmh... :) 
00059 
00060 // ASCII                              IRC Meaning
00061 // 000 NUL Null                       (Cannot be assigned)
00062 // 001 SOH Start of heading           ( CTCP Escape: only beginning of the message )
00063 // 002 STX Start of text              ( Bold text )
00064 // 003 ETX End of text                ( Color text escape sequence )
00065 // 004 EOT End of transmission        ( Assigned internally (escape) )
00066 // 005 ENQ Enquiry (WRU: Who are you) ( Assigned internally (unescape) )
00067 // 006 ACK Acknowledge                (Not so good, but can be used as last resource)
00068 // 007 BEL Bell                       ( Recognized as bell by terminals and IRCII ) (Used also by some IRC servers)
00069 // 008 BS  Backspace                  (Should not be assigned: terminal control)
00070 // 009 HT  Horizontal tabulation      (Should not be assigned: terminal control)
00071 // 010 LF  Line feed                  (Should not be assigned: terminal control)
00072 // 011 VT  Vertical tabulation        (Should not be assigned: terminal control)
00073 // 012 FF  Form feed                  (Should not be assigned: terminal control)
00074 // 013 CR  Carriage return            (Should not be assigned: terminal control)
00075 // 014 SO  Shift out                  (Should not be assigned: terminal control)
00076 // 015 SI  Shift in                   ( Resets Bold,Color,Underline and Reverse ) (Conflicting with terminal control)
00077 // 016 DLE Data link escape           (Decent, can be assigned)
00078 // 017 DC1 Device control 1           (Good to be assigned)
00079 // 018 DC2 Device control 2           (Good to be assigned)
00080 // 019 DC3 Device control 3           (Good to be assigned)
00081 // 020 DC4 Device control 4           (Good to be assigned)
00082 // 021 NAK Negative acknowledge       (Not so good, but could be used as last resource)
00083 // 022 SYN Synchronous idle           ( Reverse text )
00084 // 023 ETB End of transmission block  (Decent, can be assigned)
00085 // 024 CAN Cancel                     (Should not be assigned: terminal control)
00086 // 025 EM  End of medium              (Decent, can be assigned)
00087 // 026 SUB Substitute                 (Should not be assigned: terminal control)
00088 // 027 ESC Escape                     (Should not be assigned: terminal control)
00089 // 028 FS  File separator             (Excellent, should be used as first candidate)
00090 // 029 GS  Group separator            ( ICONS Escape: beginning of a word )
00091 // 030 RS  Record separator           ( CRYPT Escape: only beginning of the message )
00092 // 031 US  Unit separator             ( Underline text )
00093 
00094 
00095 //
00096 // mIrc control codes
00097 //
00098 //31 (0001 1111) US (Unit separator)
00099 //2  (0000 0010) STX (Start of text)
00100 //15 (0000 1111) SI (Shift in)
00101 //22 (0001 0110) SYN (Synchronous idle)
00102 //3  (0000 0011) ETX (End of text)
00103 
00104 // FIXME: Recent versions of mIrc use 29 as Italic text escape.
00105 //        This collides with our icon escape and creates a backward compatibility problem if we want to follow mIrc.
00106 
00107 //
00108 // Irc control codes
00109 //
00110 //1 (0000 0001) SOH (Start of heading)
00111 
00112 //
00113 // KVirc added control codes
00114 //
00115 //30 (0001 1110) RS (Record separator)
00116 //29 (0001 1101) GS (Group separator)
00117 
00118

00124 {
00129         enum Color {
00130                 White       =   0,   
00131                 Black       =   1,   
00132                 DarkBlue    =   2,   
00133                 DarkGreen   =   3,   
00134                 Red         =   4,   
00135                 DarkRed     =   5,   
00136                 DarkViolet  =   6,   
00137                 Orange      =   7,   
00138                 Yellow      =   8,   
00139                 LightGreen  =   9,   
00140                 BlueMarine  =  10,   
00141                 LightBlue   =  11,   
00142                 Blue        =  12,   
00143                 LightViolet =  13,   
00144                 DarkGray    =  14,   
00145                 LightGray   =  15,   
00146                 Transparent = 100,   
00147                 NoChange    = 101    
00148         };
00149 
00154         enum Control {
00155                 CTCP        = 0x01,   
00156                 Bold        = 0x02,   
00157                 Color       = 0x03,   
00158                 Escape      = 0x04,   
00159                 UnEscape    = 0x05,   
00160                 UnIcon      = 0x06,   
00161                 Reset       = 0x0f,   
00162                 Reverse     = 0x16,   
00163                 Icon        = 0x1d,   
00164                 CryptEscape = 0x1e,   
00165                 Underline   = 0x1f    
00166         };
